results.title: The Life that lives on man
results.creator_credit: Michael Andrews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Skin, for all its accessibility is one of the least studied organs of the body. Looks at the whole ecology of bacteria, yeasts and animals, which are a human being’s intimate companions through life.

results.title: The Other way
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents the ideas of E.F. Schumacher, a British economist who is deeply concerned with dwindling fuel supplies, myths about modern technology, and the loss of human worth in 20th-century consumer production. Emphasises his idea that many modern machines use too much energy and that there is a need to develop an intermediate technology of machines that consume less energy. Commentary by Ian Holm.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents the ideas of E.F. Schumacher, a British economist who is deeply concerned with dwindling fuel supplies, myths about modern technology, and the loss of human worth in 20th-century consumer production. Emphasises his idea that many modern machines use too much energy and that there is a need to develop an intermediate technology of machines that consume less energy. Commentary by Ian Holm.

results.title: The Fugitives = les fugitifs
results.creator_credit: Francis Veber, Jean-Jose Richer, DD Productions, Efye Films, Fideline Films and Orly Films
results.brief_description: This is the story of two men, Lucas and Pignon. Lucas is a hardened criminal, a star bank robber. Pignon is just the opposite, a nice guy with lots of problems he just cant cope with. Lucas, who has just done five years in jail, has decided to go straight. Pignon, who has just gone through three years unemployment has decided to become a crook. These two men have nothing in common. No reason to ever meet. And yet one day in a bank they do, and that is where the misadventures start. Remade in Hollywood as The Three fugitives starring Nick Nolte and Martin Short.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Veber, Jean-Jose Richer, DD Productions, Efye Films, Fideline Films and Orly Films

Pignon is just the opposite, a nice guy with lots of problems he just cant cope with. Lucas, who has just done five years in jail, has decided to go straight. Pignon, who has just gone through three years unemployment has decided to become a crook. These two men have nothing in common. No reason to ever meet. And yet one day in a bank they do, and that is where the misadventures start. Remade in Hollywood as The Three fugitives starring Nick Nolte and Martin Short.

results.title: The Real bionic man
results.creator_credit: Stuart Harris and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the space part surgery business, of which the very fundamental technical problems remain to be solved after thirty-five years. Only very simple artificial limbs are possible. Hospitals and medical centres are visited in search of bionic man and finally the program tries to visualise what an actual bionic man would look like.
results.description:

results.title: Dean and Donna
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Martyn Down, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Part of a series designed to facilitate discussion of various issues and themes related to social education, human relations and personal development and designed for use with primary-school and lower secondary school children in the 8 to 14 year age range. This part looks at Donna and Dean who are learning to adjust to different ‘blended family’ situations. Donna and her natural brother Scott have joined older brothers and sisters. Donna is now no longer the eldest. Dean lives with his father and new step-mother. They have recently had a baby. Explores the feelings they express while they are seeking to make the necessary readjustments.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Martyn Down, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Intimate relations
results.creator_credit: Stephen Rose and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
What makes us continue to seek long term relationships when the chances of failure are so high? American researchers interviewed hundreds of couples, married and divorced and identified the emotional pitfalls that have become the dominant causes of marital breakdown. They discuss how couples can avoid these mistakes and make intimacy the basis of a stable relationship. Narrator: Ian Holm

results.title: Pedal power
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A new look at the self-propelled bicycle, the most effective known way of translating energy into motion. Traces the development of the bicycle and examines the bicycle’s possible role in the modern transport scene in the light of the present world fuel crisis.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A new look at the self-propelled bicycle, the most effective known way of translating energy into motion. Traces the development of the bicycle and examines the bicycle’s possible role in the modern transport scene in the light of the present world fuel crisis.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A new look at the self-propelled bicycle, the most effective known way of translating energy into motion. Traces the development of the bicycle and examines the bicycle’s possible role in the modern transport scene in the light of the present world fuel crisis.

results.title: The Scientist and the baby
results.creator_credit: Christopher La Fontaine and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
In obstetrics, as in every branch of medicine, research is opening up new avenues of health care. Opposition to the intrusion of science in pregnancy and childbirth is fierce but the medical profession believe that science has proved its case.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher La Fontaine and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
In obstetrics, as in every branch of medicine, research is opening up new avenues of health care. Opposition to the intrusion of science in pregnancy and childbirth is fierce but the medical profession believe that science has proved its case.
